[bq="SquiggyBomb"]I think X-Men Evolution needs to be reevaluated.[/bq]
!http://i2.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/newsfeed/000/890/626/ff3.jpg!
X-men Evolution was a good show.



And in other news L'Oreal is using 3d printed skin to test their products.

Why this is a good thing:
1)You don't need animal testing
2)The results are more definitive cause you're testing it on human cells.
3)Test results are much quicker cause you're skipping all the animal testing phases.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55623e1a6368723ed85c1c00#post_55623e1a6368723ed85c1c00
Truth be told I've only watched like six episodes of the series. Never been the biggest X-men fan. It does that thing that I don't like in writing. Instead of developing the characters that have already been established and using that to push the plot it just introduces new characters and further clutters the series. X-men has the exact same problem as Bleach.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55623f166368725d5a000900#post_55623f166368725d5a000900
To be fair it's less of a series that is part of a bigger series and more of a standalone series as a introduction for people that have never watched it.

One of the biggest problems with the superhero genre is tv shows or movies that assume you already know everything about the franchise; when in reality if you throw every character and the kitchen sink at people that have never seen anything related to it all at once they don't get excited, rather they just get confused as fuck.

That's why the majority of current Marvel movies are so good is because you don't need a Phd in comic book history to understand the story.

topics.body:
Oh my god; the most hilarious political double fail happened today.

Basically what happened what that republicans in congress blocked a bill with a part of it was to expand the nsa's spying, but they drastically overestimated their support for a bill to continue the nsa's spying.

It would be like someone trying to win a 100 meter sprint by tying the other runner's shoe laces together, then when the opposition trips he grabs onto him accidentally ripping his pants off and causing the person who tried to sabotage to run headfirst into a light pole with him ripping the cable and as a result ripping out the power for half the stadium levels fail.

To summarize why this is important the nsa and the fbi have to drastically reduce their spying, not cause they don't have a lot of support in congress, but because congress is so inept that their "brilliant" plan to sabotage the other party resulted in a double fail.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
